message:
During my quest to make better use of my time, i started listening to podcasts a couple of months ago and that really helped me save time and make use of otherwise wasted time, so i wrote a blog post about some of my favorite podcasts.

In the blog post i wrote short description about each podcast along with average duration of episodes, podcast website, and direct RSS feed URL to add to your podcast app.

=========================
The tl;dr version:
PHP-related Podcasts
- /dev/hell
- PHP Town Hall
Laravel-related Podcasts
- Laravel News
- The Laravel Podcast
Linux-related Podcasts
- LINUX Unplugged
- The Linux Action Show
=========================

This is the first part, i'll write another post about podcasts concerned with security and software development in general.
story: Mahmoud Tantawy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: My Favorite Podcasts
caption: mtantawy.com
description: As developers we are expected to be always up-to-date, which is a very exhausting task, some developers follow RSS feeds, subscribe to newsletters, or follow twitter accounts, i used to do all thatâ€¦

data.message:
I like listening to Hanselminutes (by Scott Hanselman) while driving from Cairo to Alex and back, it's not technical, but it's informative and fun :)
I don't think I could focus on podcasts when driving to and from work though, too much is happening on the road :\

cool .. my 2 cents, these are mostly Bussiness/Freelancing Oriented
#TheGentlyMad
#TheSmarterFreelancing
#ThoughtWorks (yes they have a podcast)
#AgileForHumans

more general podcasts
http://fourhourworkweek.com/podcast/
http://podbay.fm/show/794030859
https://mixergy.com/welcome/
